Title: Amygdalar connections with middle and inferior temporal gyri of the monkey
Abstract: The origins and terminations of the amygdalar connections with middle (ITm) and inferior temporal (ITi) gyri of inferotemporal cortex (area TE) were studied in Japanese monkeys by the horseradish peroxidase method. The ITm gyrus received a major projection from the lateral basal nucleus and a minor one from the accessory basal nucleus of the amygdala, whereas it sent a major projection to the lateral nucleus and a minor one to the lateral basal nucleus. The ITi gyrus had only minor amygdalar projections from the medial basal nucleus and to the medial basal and lateral nuclei.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Region_Parcellation: Middle and inferior temporal gyrus (ITm & ITi), parahippocampal gyrus (TF & TH), perirhinal cortex (35), temporal pole area TG, area TEO
@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation:
"Middle and inferior temporal (ITm and ITi, respectively) gyri of the macaque monkey are collectively called inferotemporal (IT) cortex. Both the gyri are cytoarchitectonically classified as a unitary area TE [17 ] and ...It is also true, however, that the IT cortex of Cercopitecus is divided into areas 21 and 20 [2] that correspond approximately ITm and ITi gyri, respectively. 
... Even a question whether the distributions of amygdalar connections with the ITm (or Brodmann's area 21) and ITi (or area 10) gyri differ from each other has not yet been examined." (p. 25)
"The IT cortex was divided into 2 subdivisions of ITm and ITi gyri; their border was established as the anterior middle temporal sulcus and its caudal extension (Fig. 1A(b)).
..."The loci and extents of HRP injectioon sites in 6 cases are indicated in Fig. 1Aa. Photomicrographs of the injection sites from the ITm case 2 and ITi case 4 are shown in Fig. 2A and B, respectively. ...Each injection site was well localized within either ITm or ITi gyrus. It should be noted here that these injection sites were located within the cytoarchitectonic area TE (Fig. 1Ab), and did not extend into the bordering areas TEO, TG, TF, TH [17] and 35 (perirhinal area) [2], although the injection site of the case 1 extended slightly into area TG." (p. 26)" (p. 26)

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation: "The nuclear classification of the amygdalar complex was the same as in the previous studies [1, 3, 11]; the  amygdala was divided into 9 nuclei and their positions are shown in Fig. 1B,C." (p. 26)
@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Comments:
The referred studies are Amaral and Price (1984), Crosby and Humphrey (1941), and Iwai and Yukie (1987).
Figure 1 shows antero-  and retrograde labeling of the amygdaloid nuclei; there is no figure showing the parcellation of the amygdaloid complex without labeling.

publication.title: Amygdalar connections with middle and inferior temporal gyri of the monkey
publication.abstract: The origins and terminations of the amygdalar connections with middle (ITm) and inferior temporal (ITi) gyri of inferotemporal cortex (area TE) were studied in Japanese monkeys by the horseradish peroxidase method. The ITm gyrus received a major projection from the lateral basal nucleus and a minor one from the accessory basal nucleus of the amygdala, whereas it sent a major projection to the lateral nucleus and a minor one to the lateral basal nucleus. The ITi gyrus had only minor amygdalar projections from the medial basal nucleus and to the medial basal and lateral nuclei.
